page.title: 09Morchard Bishop's Churches-1
page.content: The Church,built in 1434,is large for the present size of the village.It has a main altar and one side altar.The tower,a local landmark is about 95 ft. high.There is a peel of 6 bells,a choir of 17,mostly girls,and a Sunday School for small children.Fund raising is by a summer fayre a Christmas bazaar and a stewardship scheme with envelopes.Harvest Festival is also celebrated with a harvest supper and an arts festival on alternate years.The vicar is a team member of the N.Creedy group of parishes.His vicarage is in this village with daughter churches at Clannaborough, Down St.Mary and Washford Pyne.The churchyard is run by a joint committee with the Methodists.Occasional ecumenical services are held together. Electoral roll is 55.Parish Communion rite B,10am,Evensong 6.30pm.
